We describe an implemented system for robust domain - independent syntactic parsing of English , using a unification - based grammar of part - ofspeech and punctuation labels coupled with a probabilistic LR parser .We present evaluations of the system 's performance along several different dimensions ; these enable us to assess the contribution that each individual part is making to the success of the system as a whole , and thus prioririse the effort to be devoted to its further enhancement .
